basics.name: Saarim Rahman

basics.summary: I am a 3rd year student studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at the University of California, Berkeley. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2022.

education.area: Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (expected May, 2022)
courses: DATA 100 - Principles and Techniques of Data Science (IP)

work.summary: Contributed directly to the Data Hub team as a full-stack developer
highlights: Engineered solutions to formatting, sorting, and faceting on data with Java & Spring Boot
Wrote rigorous user simulation tests utilizing Jest, Junit, Cypress, and React Testing Library

work.summary: Worked closely with CTO to develop mobile application for a rising startup
highlights: Developed and prototyped UI/UX for a social media mobile app in React Native
Engineered backend API routes in Python & Flask; queried SQL tables to create app functionality
Achieved a 33% reduction in load time for users posts, messages, and linked events

work.summary: Developed internal software for the premiere blockchain hub of the East Bay
highlights: Developed cryptocurrency conversion tool with ID verification using Shapeshift & Civic APIs
Established dedicated RESTful API-centric design for easy conversion and verification in React.js
Created user interface for users to verify themselves and send currency through API

work.summary: One of ten highschool AppleCare iOS interns in the nation
highlights: Provided world class service over the phone to 1000+ customers across North America
Advised customers on how to use, set-up, and debug devices (iPhone, Apple Watch, AirPods)
Resolved a variety of customer problems while note-taking and researching technical issues

rogrammed a sparse semidefinite solver to represent Groverâ€™s Algorithm using Python and math based packages like NumPy, SciPy, MATLAB
